articles.author: Tripp Mickle
articles.title: Apple Earnings: What to Watch
articles.description: Apple is scheduled to report results for its fiscal fourth quarter after the market closes Thursday. Here’s what you need to know.

articles.author: Dan Gallagher
articles.title: The Apple in the Room
articles.description: Apple suppliers like Skyworks are able to say little about their business with the iPhone maker. That makes it hard to discuss pertinent developments with their own investors.

articles.author: The Editorial Board
articles.title: The Apple 'Windfall' That Isn't
articles.description: It’s hard to keep up with all the false tax claims, but this one is a doozy.

articles.author: Peter Loftus and Tripp Mickle
articles.title: Apple's First Medical Study Signals Broader Health Ambitions
articles.description: Apple last week released an app that will enable it to test the Apple Watch’s ability to track irregular heart rhythms as part of a study with Stanford, more evidence that Apple wants part of the $3.2 trillion U.S. health-care market.

articles.title: Apple Watch Hits Cellular Snag in China
articles.description: The new Apple Watch’s most anticipated feature—a cellular connection—was abruptly cut off for new subscribers in China. Analysts say the suspension likely stemmed from government security concerns to do with tracking users.

articles.author: Amrith Ramkumar
articles.title: Apple Is Now A $900 Billion Company
articles.description: Apple is the first U.S. company to reach $900 billion, having already become the first to hit $800 billion when it accomplished the feat in May. It now needs to grow its market capitalization by just 11% to become the first public company worth $1 trillion.

articles.author: Joe Flint
articles.title: Apple Gets Drama Series Starring Aniston, Witherspoon
articles.description: Apple has struck a deal for a new drama starring Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston and set in the world of television morning-news shows.

articles.author: Chris Dieterich
articles.title: Another Day, Another Apple Stock Decline
articles.description: Shares of the largest company by market capitalization dipped 1.1% in recent trading to $150.16. Earlier Monday the stock fell below $150 for the first time since Aug. 1.

articles.author: Joe Flint
articles.title: Apple Signs Content Deal With Steven Spielberg
articles.description: Apple is betting on acclaimed director and producer Steven Spielberg for its first major foray into creating original video content.

articles.author: Dan Gallagher
articles.title: Apple Calls Up Its Supporting Cast
articles.description: Mac, iPad and services deliver strong sales while the iPhone cycle gets stretched.

articles.author: Vanessa Fuhrmans
articles.title: The 250 Most Effectively Managed U.S. Companies
articles.description: Amazon is on top, followed by Apple and Alphabet, in a landmark ranking, the Drucker Institute’s Management Top 250.

articles.author: James R. Hagerty
articles.title: John Medica Helped Apple And Dell With Laptops
articles.description: Apple Computer and Dell called on John Medica, a boisterous electrical engineer, to lead teams that developed notebook computers.

articles.author: Joanna Stern
articles.title: iPhone X Review: Yes, There Are Reasons to Pay Apple $1,000
articles.description: Apple Inc.’s iPhone X breaks the $1,000 price barrier but gives you plenty of reasons to want it anyway.

articles.author: Amrith Ramkumar
articles.title: Stocks to Watch: Micron, Nike, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, Ford, Twitter
articles.description: Among the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Wednesday's session are Micron, Nike, Apple, Amazon.com, Alphabet and Ford.

articles.author: Amrith Ramkumar
articles.title: Stocks to Watch: Verizon, Office Depot, PepsiCo, Amazon, Apple, Monsanto
articles.description: Among the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Wednesday's session are Verizon, Office Depot, PepsiCo, Amazon.com and Apple.

articles.author: Tripp Mickle
articles.title: Apple Acquires Shazam and Its Song-Recognition App
articles.description: Apple has acquired Shazam Entertainment, giving it one of the popular song-recognition apps at a time the iPhone maker is looking to boost its music-subscription service.

articles.author: Yoko Kubota
articles.title: Apple CEO to Attend State-Run Internet Conference in China
articles.description: Apple Inc. Chief Executive Tim Cook will be the most prominent U.S. executive to participate in an event that promotes China’s vision of closely regulated cyberspace.

articles.author: Amrith Ramkumar
articles.title: Stocks to Watch: Apple, Alphabet, Amazon, Home Depot, DaVita, Walgreens, Fred’s
articles.description: Among the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Wednesday's session are Apple, Alphabet, Home Depot, DaVita and Walgreens Boots Alliance.

articles.author: Dan Strumpf
articles.title: Apple's Tim Cook: No Point Yelling at China
articles.description: Apple Inc. Chief Executive Tim Cook defended his company’s move to pull hundreds of apps from its China store to comply with Beijing’s demands.

articles.author: Chris Dieterich
articles.title: Tech ETF Investors Will Get More Apple Following Index Overhaul
articles.description: U.S. stock market giants Apple, Microsoft and Amazon.com will take up more space in popular exchange-traded funds after index rule changes take effect next year.
